alert.note: Alert for St. Landry (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 08 at 12:47PM CDT until September 08 at 1:45PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lake Charles has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... St. Landry Parish in central Louisiana... * Until 145 PM CDT. * At 1247 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Simmesport to near Bunkie, moving south at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Opelousas, Eunice, Krotz Springs, Leonville, Arnaudville, Melville, Palmetto, Bayou Current, Morrow, Sunset, Port Barre, Washington, Grand Coteau, Cankton, Prairie Ronde, Savoy, Lawtell, Whiteville, Big Cane, and Swords. This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 9 and 38, and between mile markers 41 and 42. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
